title: Create PostgreSQL Helm values for Dagster metadata
description: Configure Bitnami PostgreSQL chart for Dagster: single replica, 1Gi storage, dagster database/user

title: Create example Dagster pipeline for sovereign-dp lakehouse
description: Create a sample Dagster pipeline demonstrating the lakehouse capabilities: reading from rustfs S3 storage, querying via Trino, and writing Iceberg tables through Nessie catalog. Should serve as a reference implementation for data engineering workflows.

title: Replace MinIO with rustfs
description: Replace MinIO object storage with rustfs (https://github.com/rustfs/rustfs) - an S3-compatible storage solution

title: Test Dagster orchestration
Configure DBeaver connection
description: Optional: Set up DBeaver with Trino driver to connect to local lakehouse. Port forward 8080 and configure connection.

title: Update CLAUDE.md to require README updates before finalizing beads tasks
Add monitoring with Grafana and Prometheus
Install Trino via Helm
description: Install Trino with trino-values.yaml. Configure Iceberg catalog with Nessie, point S3 to MinIO, set credentials. Fix coordinator/worker communication.

title: Fix JupyterHub notebook image tag
Update CLAUDE.md with lakehouse architecture
description: Document the data lakehouse architecture: K8s + MinIO + Nessie + Trino + Iceberg. Include common commands for managing the stack.

title: Set up local Kubernetes cluster
description: Install and configure local K8s (minikube/kind/k3s) instead of Scaleway. Need kubectl and helm installed.

title: Create all-in-one deployment script
description: Create a single script that orchestrates the full deployment sequence: cluster setup, Helm installation, Nessie, MinIO, credentials, and Trino. Should handle dependencies and provide clear progress feedback.

title: Trino connection timeout - internal network issues causing timeouts
description: JupyterHub notebook cannot connect to Trino at trino.pileus.svc.cluster.local:8080. Trino logs show internal network issues - coordinator cannot announce to itself (localhost:8080 timeouts). Pods show Ready but connections fail. May be resource exhaustion on kind cluster or networking issue. Tried restarting Trino deployments.

title: Fix MinIO image - use official minio/minio image
Update deploy-all.sh with Dagster step
description: Add Dagster deployment as optional Step 7 in the all-in-one deployment script

title: Update README to reflect recent commits (MinIO, Nessie, Trino, deployment script)
Increase kind cluster disk space for notebook images
Fix Dagster webserver/daemon OOMKilled - increase memory limits from 512Mi to 1Gi
description: Dagster webserver has 26 restarts and daemon has 9 restarts due to OOMKilled. Current memory limit of 512Mi is too low. Need to increase to 1Gi for both components in k8s/helm-values/dagster-values.yaml and run helm upgrade.

title: Configure MinIO access credentials
description: Set up MinIO access/secret keys and policies. Need ObjectStorageFullAccess equivalent for lakehouse bucket.

title: Switch MinIO from Bitnami Helm chart to official minio/minio image - Bitnami images are unavailable on Docker Hub
Fix MinIO image tag - current tag not found
Shared PostgreSQL with pgvector support
Update rollout script to deploy all components with teardown support
description: Create/update scripts to manage the full local k8s deployment. Should be able to: 1) Roll out all components (MinIO, Nessie, Trino, etc.) with a single script, 2) Tear down everything cleanly with a corresponding script. Goal is simple local development workflow.

title: Set up local object storage (MinIO)
description: Deploy MinIO as S3-compatible object storage in K8s cluster. Create lakehouse bucket. MinIO replaces Scaleway object storage.

title: Create lakehouse namespace in K8s
description: Create lakehouse namespace: kubectl create namespace lakehouse

title: Fix rustfs health check probes
Deploy JupyterHub for notebook-based SQL queries
description: Deploy JupyterHub to the lakehouse namespace to enable interactive SQL queries via notebooks. Should integrate with Trino for SQL access to Iceberg tables. Reference: https://github.com/jupyterhub/jupyterhub
notes:
Configuration complete:
- Helm values: k8s/helm-values/jupyterhub-values.yaml (Trino integration, Python packages)
- Deployment script: scripts/setup-jupyterhub.sh
- Demo notebook: notebooks/trino-iceberg-demo.ipynb

Ready for deployment on local machine with Docker/kubectl/Helm:
  ./scripts/setup-jupyterhub.sh

Access after deployment: http://localhost:8888 (user: any, password: jupyter)

title: Add JupyterHub step to deploy-all.sh
Rename namespace from lakehouse to pileus in documentation
Create custom JupyterHub notebook image with pre-installed packages
Add Dagster orchestration to dpaas lakehouse
Create setup-namespace.sh script and add to deploy-all.sh
Install Nessie via Helm
description: Add Nessie helm repo and install with nessie-values.yaml. Configure S3 endpoint to point to local MinIO, set access/secret keys.

title: Replace MinIO with Rook for S3-compatible object storage - https://github.com/rook/rook
close_reason: Decided to stick with MinIO instead of Rook

title: Create setup-dagster.sh deployment script
description: Script to deploy PostgreSQL and Dagster: prerequisites check, Helm deployments, build/load code image, readiness waiting

title: Test Iceberg table operations
description: Port-forward Trino, use CLI to: create schema, create table with PARQUET format, insert data, query data. Verify end-to-end lakehouse functionality.

title: Deploy Trino and JupyterHub for notebook access
close_reason: Deployed Trino and JupyterHub to pileus namespace. All services running.

title: Create Dagster Helm values configuration
description: Configure Dagster Helm chart: external PostgreSQL, S3 compute logs to MinIO, NodePort 30300, code location config

title: Create Dagster Python project with lakehouse resources
description: Create dagster/ directory with pyproject.toml, Dockerfile, resources (Trino, MinIO, Iceberg), and demo assets

title: Replace all MinIO references with rustfs
Update kind-config.yaml with Dagster port mapping
description: Add Dagster webserver NodePort (30300 -> 3000) to kind cluster configuration
